result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not expose his gentalia to others. 
Trial Judge - Br 2 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

02:21 PM Defendant in court from MJTC with Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Discussion regarding adult court jurisdiction. Brief adjournment. 02:48 PM Case re-called. Continued discussion regarding jurisdiction. Parties stipulated to proceed with Initial Appearance. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
